instructions:
Melt margarine in a 10 inch cast iron skillet and mix in brown sugar and ground cloves. Place one slice of
pineapple in center of frying pan. Cut the remaining 3 slices of pineapple in half and arrange as flower
petals.
Combine ground meat and remaining ingredients and mix well. Place ham mixture between pineapple
slices and press down to hold pineapple slices in place. Then add remaining ham and press flat. Cover and
bake in a 350 F oven for 30 minutes. Remove cover and bake for about 30 minutes more or until temperature
reaches 160 F. Turn out on a flat cookie sheet, being careful of any hot glaze that may escape. Serves 6.

*(Rev. 1/22/96)*
ingredients: 1 1/2 lb ham loaf mix, (3/4 lb ham and 3/4 lb pork)
name: Upside-down Ham Loaf
